content: There are no paragraphs provided in the prev_chunk, so the curr_chunk cannot be summarized. Congress finds that John H. Johnson founded Negro Digest in 1942, which later became Black World with over 100,000 subscribers. He then created Ebony magazine, reaching a peak of 2,300,000 subscribers and addressing important African-American community issues. John H. Johnson's work included addressing African-American militancy, civil rights legislation, and showcasing positive images of African-Americans through magazines like Ebony and Jet. He also launched other magazines to serve African-American readers. John H. Johnson expanded his enterprise by becoming chairman and CEO of Supreme Life Insurance Company, owning radio stations, cosmetics line, book publishing, and TV production companies. He was invited by the US Government for international missions and honored by the NAACP in 1966. In 1966, John H. Johnson was honored by the NAACP with the Spingarn Medal for his contributions to improving race relations in the United States. He also received various awards throughout his career, including the Horatio Alger Award, Publisher of the Year, Dow Jones Entrepreneurial Excellence Award, Communication Award, and the Presidential Medal of Freedom in 1996. In 1997, Johnson was inducted into the Junior Achievement National Business Hall of Fame, followed by the Arkansas Business Hall of Fame in 2001. He has received honorary doctorates from several universities including Harvard, USC, and Carnegie Mellon. The Speaker of the House and the President pro tempore of the Senate will award a gold medal to John H. Johnson for his exceptional work and leadership. The Secretary of the Treasury will design and strike the medal. Duplicates in bronze may be sold under regulations set by the Secretary to cover costs. The medals struck under this Act are considered national medals. Funds from the United States Mint Public Enterprise Fund will be used to cover the costs, and proceeds from the sale of duplicate bronze medals will be deposited back into the Fund.
